sen.j: 高木 正弘（たかぎ まさひろ、慶長18年（1613年） － 明暦4年6月23日 (旧暦)（1658年7月23日））は、河内国丹南藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: Masahiro TAKAGI (1613 to July 23, 1965) was the third lord of the Tannan Domain in Kawachi Province.
Masahiro TAKAGI (1613 to July 23, 1965) was the third lord of the Tannan Domain in Kawachi Province.
Masahiro TAKAGI (1613 - July 23, 1965) was the third lord of the Tannan Domain in Kawachi Province.
sen.cmt: to をハイフンに訂正しました。

sen.j: 第2代藩主・高木正成の長男。
sen.e: Masahiro was the eldest son of Masanari TAKAGI, the second lord of the domain.
Masahiro was the eldest son of Masanari TAKAGI, the second lord of the domain.
Masahiro was the eldest son of Masanari TAKAGI, the second lord of the domain.

sen.j: 母は山口重政の養女（竹田某の娘）。
sen.e: His mother was Shigemasa YAMAGUCHI's adopted daughter (daughter of a person named TAKEDA).
His mother was Shigemasa YAMAGUCHI's adopted daughter (daughter of a person named TAKEDA).
His mother was Shigemasa YAMAGUCHI's adopted daughter (daughter of a person named TAKEDA).
His officially recognized wife was Yasunaga SHIBATA's daughter.
His officially recognized wife was Yasunaga SHIBATA's daughter.
His officially recognized wife was Yasunaga SHIBATA's daughter.

sen.j: 子に高木正盛（長男）、高木清長（次男）、高木正綱（三男）、娘（板倉重形正室）、娘（石川総氏正室）。
sen.e: He had five children: Masamori TAKAGI (eldest son), Kiyonaga TAKAGI (second son), Masatsuna TAKAGI (third son), a daughter (Shigekata ITAKURA's officially recognized wife) and another daughter (Fusauji ISHIKAWA's officially recognized wife).
sen.cmt: 高木清長および石川総氏の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: He had five children: Masamori TAKAGI (eldest son), Kiyonaga TAKAGI (second son), Masatsuna TAKAGI (third son), a daughter (Shigekata ITAKURA's officially recognized wife) and another daughter (Fusauji ISHIKAWA's officially recognized wife).

He had five children: Masamori TAKAGI (eldest son), Kiyonaga TAKAGI (second son), Masatsuna TAKAGI (third son), a daughter (Shigekata ITAKURA's officially recognized wife) and another daughter (Fusauji ISHIKAWA's officially recognized wife).
He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was awarded the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was appointed by the shogunate as Mondo no sho (Chief of the Water Office).
He was appointed by the shogunate as Mondo no sho (Chief of the Water Office).
He was appointed by the shogunate as Mondo no sho (Chief of the Water Office).
He was called Zenjiro when he was a child.
He was called Zenjiro when he was a child.
He was called Zenjiro when he was a child.

sen.j: 寛永8年（1631年）、上総国内で1000石を与えられた。
sen.e: In 1631, Masahiro was allowed to rule a territory in Kazusa Province worth 1,000 koku of rice.
In 1631, Masahiro was allowed to rule a territory in Kazusa Province worth 1,000 koku of rice.
In 1631, Masahiro was allowed to rule a territory in Kazusa Province worth 1,000 koku of rice.

sen.j: 寛永12年（1635年）、父の死去により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1635, he succeeded his father as the lord of the Tannan Domain after the latter's death.
In 1635, he succeeded his father as the lord of the Tannan Domain after the latter's death.
In 1635, he succeeded his father as the lord of the Tannan Domain after the latter's death.

sen.j: このとき、家督相続前に与えられていた1000石は没収され、父が生前に与えられていた3000石の加増分も高木正好、高木正房の2人の弟に分与した。
sen.e: When he succeeded his father as the lord of his domain, he not only forfeited his right to the 1,000 koku that he had previously been awarded, but also gave away the right to 3,000 koku that his father had been awarded in addition to the rice yields from his own domain to his two younger brothers, Masayoshi TAKAGI and Masafusa TAKAGI.
sen.cmt: 高木正好および高木正房の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: When he succeeded his father as the lord of his domain, he not only forfeited his right to the 1,000 koku that he had previously been awarded, but also gave away the right to 3,000 koku that his father had been awarded in addition to the rice yields from his own domain to his two younger brothers, Masayoshi TAKAGI and Masafusa TAKAGI.

When he succeeded his father as the lord of his domain, he not only forfeited his right to the 1,000 koku that he had previously been awarded, but also gave away the right to 3,000 koku that his father had been awarded in addition to the rice yields from his own domain to his two younger brothers, Masayoshi TAKAGI and Masafusa TAKAGI.

sen.j: 大番頭、次いで二条城の守衛となったが、在任中の明暦4年（1658年）6月23日に死去した。
sen.e: Masahiro was appointed as Obangashira (head of shogunate guards) and as a guard of Nijo Castle, but died on June 23 (traditional Japanese calendar month), 1658 during his tenure of office.
Masahiro was appointed as Obangashira (head of shogunate guards) and as a guard of Nijo Castle, but died on June 23 (traditional Japanese calendar month), 1658 during his tenure of office.
Masahiro was appointed as Obangashira (head of shogunate guards) and as a guard of Nijo Castle, but died on July 23, 1658 during his tenure of office.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました、(traditional Japanese calendar month)削除しました。

sen.e: He died at the age of 46.
He died at the age of 46.
He died at the age of 46.

sen.j: 後を長男の正盛が継いだ。
sen.e: He was succeeded by Masamori, his eldest son.
He was succeeded by Masamori, his eldest son.
He was succeeded by Masamori, his eldest son.

sen.j: 墓所：京都市左京区黒谷町の金戒光明寺光守院。
sen.e: His grave is in Konkaikomyo-ji Koshu-in Temple in Kurodani-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
His grave is in Konkaikomyo-ji Koshu-in Temple in Kurodani-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
His grave is in Konkaikomyo-ji Koshu-in Temple in Kurodani-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
